description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = value of Schoenheim bound L_1(n+2,k+2,k+1) on covering numbers (0 <= k <= n).
comments: The relation with Schoenheim's notation is L(v,k,t,l) = psi(k,t,l,v). - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 12 2012
references: W. H. Mills and R. C. Mullin, Coverings and packings, pp. 371-399 of J. H. Dinitz and D. R. Stinson, editors,a Contemporary Design Theory, Wiley, 1992. See Eq. 1.
links: J. Schoenheim, On coverings, Pac. J. Math. 14 (4) (1964) 1405-1411.
maple: L := proc(v,k,t,l)    local i,t1;    t1 := l;    for i from v-t+1 to v do        t1 := ceil(t1*i/(i-(v-k)));    od:    t1;end;A036838 := proc(n,k)    L(n+2,k+2,k+1,1) ;end proc:
mathematica: L[v_, k_, t_, l_] := Module[{i, t1}, t1 = l; For[i = v-t+1, i <= v, i++, t1 = Ceiling[t1*i/(i-(v-k))]]; t1]; A036838[n_, k_] := L[n+2, k+2, k+1, 1]; Table[A036838[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Sep 16 2013, translated from Maple *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 11 2002
